titleStmt.title: William Kaye et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6525

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

We the undersigned Jurors who tried Edward Mitchell at the May term of the Jefferson Circuit Court on a charge of murder & found him guilty of Manslaughter & convicted him for two years do most earnestly petition your Excellency to grant him a pardon

Very Respectfully
Wm. Kaye
William Bailey
Saml Parker foreman
C. L. Down
B. F. Rudy
Thomas Schorch

I James P Chambers Clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court state afsd and hereby Certify that the six foregoing signatures are signatures of the jury that was sworn in the case of the Comwlth vs Edward Mitchell
Given under my hand as clerk of said Court this 19 day of May 1865
